<<<<<<< HEAD
Thou shalt not fear God, and reverence my sanctuary. A sharp rebuke, or A rod for the enemies of common prayer, that wrote the book of unmasking it with lies; I also prove it to be the pure worship of God taken out of his word, his revealed will. By Thomas Hicks. Hicks, Thomas, 17th cent.
[1], 7 p.
printed by R.L., London : 1660.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Sept 11.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library. A reply to: The common prayer-book unmasked.
=======

[1], 7 p.
printed by R.L., London : 1660.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Sept 11.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library. A reply to: The common prayer-book unmasked.
